reviews.text: We have stayed at the RB Inn many, many times over the last 20 years. I'm sorry to say that this resort has slowly and steadily gone down hill and our last stay in August will be our last stay.
reviews.title: Needs major improvements

likes.disliked: — Most of the staff is hopeless. The front desk and our bell boy were terrific.

reviews.text: We stayed in a renovated room. The room and bedding are very nice, but why, oh why, didn't they renovate the bathrooms? The 70's tile really has to go and the faucet fixtures are so old. I can't remember the last time I saw a plastic ball shower knob. They have flat panel tv's but they are all configured incorrectly so the picture is so stretched out everyone looks 4' tall and twice the weight they actually are.
reviews.title: Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last year - July and August. Both times we spent several days at the adult pool and were very disappointed in the lack of pool side drink/food service. One day no one ever appeared. Another day we moved to the bar across from the golf shop to sip a few drinks and watch the football game. The service was absolutely horrible. Our waitress and the bartender were so rude we had to get management to discuss their behavior (it's a long story). After returning 2 drinks that were mixed incorrectly, we watched as the bartender poured 2 separate drinks from our glasses into one cocktail shaker, added something, and poured into our 2 used glasses. The waitress attempted to reserve to us, when I informed her that we wouldn't be drinking those drinks and that what the bartender just did was a health code violation...... I could go on and on about the lack of response from her and the angry bartender - it was unbelievable!
reviews.title: Wasn't all we expected

likes.liked: — Lobby buildings, views and grounds were very nice. Spa was wonderful.
likes.disliked: — Pillows were terrible -- hallways were dirty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One morning we left our room early, walked out the door and was assaulted with the worst stench I've ever experienced. Apparently the sewer system had backed up the day before and they had scheduled maintenance - now don't you think they would have asked us to move rooms the night before???? It was so disgusting my husband and I almost threw-up trying to get to our car.
reviews.title: Overall, it was nice

reviews.text: The next morning, Sunday, we decided to sit outside in our little patio, have a cup of coffee and read the paper. Unfortunately, the gardener thought it was a good idea to use the blower to clear leaves on Sunday at 8:30 am and proceeded to do this and was actually blowing leaves into our patio! That was it for me. I met with the Asst. Manager, apparently the GM didn't have time, I told him all my complaints in a very nice way and my disappointment that I wouldn't be coming back to what use to be one of my favorite places. He listened with what seemed like interest (took notes), and I never heard another thing.
reviews.title: Disorganized, Pretentious and Poorly Maintained

likes.liked: — The part where I drove away.
likes.disliked: — Bloodstain on the comforter! I still can't get over it.

reviews.text: I stayed here during a conference for two nights in January. This is a lovely resort, with a series of low-rise buildings spread over a hillside. It was pouring rain for most of the time that we were there, but even in the rain, it was a pleasant place to stay - attractively decorated, good food, nice landscaping and lovely pools.
reviews.title: Lovely Facility

likes.disliked: — It was pouring rain - but they couldn't help that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one caveat is that this place seems to have no elevators - so anyone who doesn't want to walk a fair amount should think twice.
reviews.title: Best in the Area by a Long Way

reviews.text: We had a great stay here. Service could not have been better. You just drive up to the door, leaving the motor running on your car and a bellhop parks it for you instantly. Two more bellhops open both doors of the hotel. Smashing. When you want your car back, a bellhop instantly runs to get it. What more can you ask for? Breakfast is wonderful. We didn't try lunch or dinner. Yes, the bathrooms are showing their age, but they are very well maintained. Bedrooms are refurbished and beds and linens are excellent. Sound proofing is excellent.
reviews.title: Well Worth A Visit

reviews.text: We stayed on a bed and breakfast package booked directly with the hotel, and it actually cost less than the local motels. At that price it is a no brainer.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Spa and Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rancho Bernardo Inn is one of those resorts at which you need to stay for several days to unwind and enjoy the amenities. Unfortunately I was there for only one night, and that on business. From my brief stay, though, I saw that it is a warm, inviting resort consisting of a cluster of smallish buildings connected by winding garden paths. There are numerous small fountains and tranquil gardens scattered throughout. The lobby is an upscale rustic Southwestern decor, with an open fireplace. Very inviting and comfortable. The property is reached by driving to the far end of a residential area, meaning that there is no street traffic or noise. The rooms are extremely comfortable and are well equipped for business travelers. The inn automatically charges an all inclusive fee, so you don't have to pay extra for wireless internet access in the room or throughout the property. The hotel's business center was not all that well equipped, but the Rancho Bernardo town center (with a Kinkos) is nearby. It was a great location for our small business meeting, and I can see where a few days here could be very relaxing.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

likes.disliked: — Far from other San Diego area attractions.

reviews.text: We stayed at RB a year ago, but our experience was limited by remodeling. We noted our issues on TA, and the resort contacted us to return for a subsidized visit.
reviews.title: What a great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were impressed! The people were tremendous, not just helping us, but filling in for each other. The teamwork we saw is a great reflection on the management.
reviews.title: Loved the Rancho Bernardo Inn but Non-smokers beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt welcomed by the valets. The check-in was thorough, striving to arrange every benefit for out stay.
reviews.title: Nice place, GREAT Restaurant
Veranda Restaurant
reviews.text: We had a terrific room, 625, with beautiful views of the valley and golf course, and was centered over the spa’s pool. Our room was just the right size, well organized, and luxurious while maintaining the rustic feel of RB. Wireless access was fast and easy. The room came with a large LCD TV (analog) and DVD with normal hotel pay per view. We really liked the IHome alarm that allowed us to wake to our IPOD and recharged it too. Electrical outlets were sufficient, an unexpected plus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the busy holiday season, we did not sample the El Biz Cocho restaurant. The Veranda was casual, family friendly, and served a well rounded menu of great food.
reviews.title: Very comfortable bed - But....

likes.disliked: — Room had a connecting door to adjoining room allowing noisy children in room next door to awaken us very early on a Saturday morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I checked in for an evening getaway on Sunday, May 18. I read the glowing reviews on this site and noticed the hotels's ads hyping their recent 25 million renovation. I thought the hotel would be the sort of resort worthy of a $350.00 room rate (again, on a Sunday evening). I was mislead.
reviews.title: Renovations? What Renovations?

reviews.text: After checking in, we walked down the musty halls full of signs indicating various conference and wedding locations. The room, overlooking the back pool, was equally musty, dark, and damp. The decor was dated and I would compare it to an upscale Howard Johnson. Yes, it was clean and a good size. However, if there were renovations (again, find hard to believe), they were done on the cheap. The bathroom was the same - upscale Hojo style. Cheap tilework in the shower, plastic seeming fixtures, and the like.
reviews.title: Recently renovated resort---money well spent!

likes.disliked: — Breakfast room service was backed up

reviews.title: cool hotel
reviews.text: We decided to step out by the pool and relax. Let's just say it was a D.I.Y. pool. No one offered a drink, to help us with towels, or anything of the sort. We visited the spa pool on the following day - never even saw anyone. When I checked out, I was not asked whether I enjoyed my stay, otherwise, I would have mentioned some of my issues to the desk person.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The excpetion to the overall D.I.Y. service was at the spa. I had a wonderful massage and the spa staff was terrific. The restaurant servers were very attentive as well - the food was standard hotel fare. Nothing great, nothing bad.
reviews.title: Peaceful and Relaxing

reviews.text: Overall, this hotel deserves more of a 2 or 3 star rating. It certainly is not worthy of the price paid. Service was spotty (never saw bell service checking in our out - seemed non existent) with the exception of the spa and the restaurant. Perhaps if we were part of one of the many conferences happening, we would have received a better room or more attention.
reviews.title: Great service, lovely room

likes.disliked: — Changing the sheets every night is a complete waste.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Rancho Bernardo Inn for one night. We booked our room for $79 through a bidding travel site and understood at the time that RBI had extra fees, bringing our total to just over $100 upon checkout.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: PROS: The grounds are beautiful; the buildings we saw were beautiful; I liked the idea that they had an adult swimming pool and a children's pool. Our room was spacious and well-decorated, and had a very comfortable bed and a nice patio. The internet access was easy and included in the "extras" fee. The bathroom was extra-spacious and the toiletries were "yummy". The air conditioning worked and the room was very, very quiet. Only heard other people the next morning in the hallway. For the price we paid, this was a good value.
reviews.title: Rancho Bernardo Inn disappointing
Beautiful Grounds, Sub-par Service
reviews.text: CONS: Here are the reasons I had to take points off. a) The extras fee. That's a bad idea - customers leave your establishment with a bad taste. b) The front desk attendants: Here's a thought: if two people approach the desk together, don't speak only to one person, totally ignoring the other. When we were given our room key, the clerk said to my husband "Welcome Mr. Smith" and there was no welcome for or acknowledgment of me. Nice customer service! c) It was weird that we had to drive through a neighborhood - small but neat mid-age homes. The driveway entrance was strange - a little unclear on what to do. d) We tried to use the concierge - no one was at the desk. Maybe it was a weird time - an hour or two before dinner. (wink) We had NO earthly idea of the dining establishments in the area and drove for about an hour before settling on a "chain" (which is what we were trying to avoid). e) The valets, when they had nothing to do, chatted away inappropriately (it was difficult not to eavesdrop) about subjects that particularly female customers shouldn't be subjected to. In a nutshell, the reason this isn't "excellent" is due to the help.
Overall, our experience was good, but the management should know where and how to improve this establishment.
reviews.title: good north county location
Bad plumbing, uneven service, bill was never correct
reviews.text: We arrived at the Rancho Bernardo Inn Saturday evening with a pre paid reservation. We were told by the girl on duty at the front desk "sorry we can't accomodate you, we are full"
